sentence.text: Uncorrected refrcoenzyme A biosynthetic processive errors constitute the most common cause of vision loss and second leading cause of blindness worldwide.

We have previously identified a role for the secreted serine protease camera-type eye development in ocular size determination and camera-type eye development variants have been implicated in the etiology of both hyperopia and myopia, highlighting its importance in refrcoenzyme A biosynthetic processive development.

Here, we use a combination of genetic mouse models to demonstrate that camera-type eye development mutations leading to reduced ocular size and hyperopia coenzyme A biosynthetic process via a loss of function mechanism.
Finally, we demonstrate that genetic incoenzyme A biosynthetic processivation of camera-type eye development rescues axial elongation in a mouse model of myopia caused by a null mutation in Egr1.

Overall, our findings identify camera-type eye development as a potential therapeutic target for modulating ocular growth aimed at preventing or slowing down myopia, which is reaching epidemic proportions
